info.title: Key Vault
info.description:
The key vault client performs cryptographic key operations and vault operations
against the Key Vault service.

get.summary: Lists deleted secrets for the specified vault.
get.description:
The Get Deleted Secrets operation returns the secrets that have been deleted
for a vault enabled for soft-delete. This operation requires the secrets/list
permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description:
Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service
will return up to 25 results.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.description:
The Get Deleted Secret operation returns the specified deleted secret along
with its attributes. This operation requires the secrets/get permission.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

delete.description:
The purge deleted secret operation removes the secret permanently, without the
possibility of recovery. This operation can only be enabled on a soft-delete
enabled vault. This operation requires the secrets/purge permission.

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.summary: Recovers the deleted secret to the latest version.
post.description:
Recovers the deleted secret in the specified vault. This operation can only be
performed on a soft-delete enabled vault. This operation requires the
secrets/recover permission.

parameters.name: secretName
parameters.description: The name of the deleted secret.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.summary: List secrets in a specified key vault.
get.description:
The Get Secrets operation is applicable to the entire vault. However, only the
base secret identifier and its attributes are provided in the response.
Individual secret versions are not listed in the response. This operation
requires the secrets/list permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description:
Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service
will return up to 25 results.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

put.summary: Sets a secret in a specified key vault.
put.description:
The SET operation adds a secret to the Azure Key Vault. If the named secret
already exists, Azure Key Vault creates a new version of that secret. This
operation requires the secrets/set permission.

parameters.name: secretName
parameters.description:
The name of the secret. The value you provide may be copied globally for the
purpose of running the service. The value provided should not include
personally identifiable or sensitive information.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for setting the secret.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

delete.summary: Deletes a secret from a specified key vault.
delete.description:
The DELETE operation applies to any secret stored in Azure Key Vault. DELETE
cannot be applied to an individual version of a secret. This operation requires
the secrets/delete permission.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.summary: Get a specified secret from a given key vault.
get.description:
The GET operation is applicable to any secret stored in Azure Key Vault. This
operation requires the secrets/get permission.

parameters.name: secretVersion
parameters.description:
The version of the secret. This URI fragment is optional. If not specified, the
latest version of the secret is returned.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

patch.summary: Updates the attributes associated with a specified secret in a given key vault.
patch.description:
The UPDATE operation changes specified attributes of an existing stored secret.
Attributes that are not specified in the request are left unchanged. The value
of a secret itself cannot be changed. This operation requires the secrets/set
permission.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for update secret operation.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description:
Requests that a backup of the specified secret be downloaded to the client. All
versions of the secret will be downloaded. This operation requires the
secrets/backup permission.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.summary: List all versions of the specified secret.
get.description:
The full secret identifier and attributes are provided in the response. No
values are returned for the secrets. This operations requires the secrets/list
permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description:
Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service
will return up to 25 results.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.summary: Restores a backed up secret to a vault.
post.description:
Restores a backed up secret, and all its versions, to a vault. This operation
requires the secrets/restore permission.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to restore the secret.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

Attributes.description: The object attributes managed by the KeyVault service.

enabled.description: Determines whether the object is enabled.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

BackupSecretResult.description: The backup secret result, containing the backup blob.

value.description: The backup blob containing the backed up secret.

DeletedSecretBundle.description:
A Deleted Secret consisting of its previous id, attributes and its tags, as
well as information on when it will be purged.

contentType.description: The content type of the secret.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

kid.description:
If this is a secret backing a KV certificate, then this field specifies the
corresponding key backing the KV certificate.

managed.description:
True if the secret's lifetime is managed by key vault. If this is a secret
backing a certificate, then managed will be true.

recoveryId.description: The url of the recovery object, used to identify and recover the deleted secret.

scheduledPurgeDate.description: The time when the secret is scheduled to be purged, in UTC

deletedDate.description: The time when the secret was deleted, in UTC

DeletedSecretItem.description: The deleted secret item containing metadata about the deleted secret.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

contentType.description: Type of the secret value such as a password.

managed.description:
True if the secret's lifetime is managed by key vault. If this is a key backing
a certificate, then managed will be true.

recoveryId.description: The url of the recovery object, used to identify and recover the deleted secret.

scheduledPurgeDate.description: The time when the secret is scheduled to be purged, in UTC

deletedDate.description: The time when the secret was deleted, in UTC

value.description: The DeletedSecretItem items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

DeletionRecoveryLevel.description:
Reflects the deletion recovery level currently in effect for secrets in the
current vault. If it contains 'Purgeable', the secret can be permanently
deleted by a privileged user; otherwise, only the system can purge the secret,
at the end of the retention interval.

values.name: Purgeable
values.description:
Denotes a vault state in which deletion is an irreversible operation, without
the possibility for recovery. This level corresponds to no protection being
available against a Delete operation; the data is irretrievably lost upon
accepting a Delete operation at the entity level or higher (vault, resource
group, subscription etc.)

values.name: Recoverable_Purgeable
values.description:
Denotes a vault state in which deletion is recoverable, and which also permits
immediate and permanent deletion (i.e. purge). This level guarantees the
recoverability of the deleted entity during the retention interval (90 days),
unless a Purge operation is requested, or the subscription is cancelled. System
wil permanently delete it after 90 days, if not recovered

values.name: Recoverable
values.description:
Denotes a vault state in which deletion is recoverable without the possibility
for immediate and permanent deletion (i.e. purge). This level guarantees the
recoverability of the deleted entity during the retention interval(90 days) and
while the subscription is still available. System wil permanently delete it
after 90 days, if not recovered

values.name: Recoverable_ProtectedSubscription
values.description:
Denotes a vault and subscription state in which deletion is recoverable within
retention interval (90 days), immediate and permanent deletion (i.e. purge) is
not permitted, and in which the subscription itself  cannot be permanently
canceled. System wil permanently delete it after 90 days, if not recovered

values.name: CustomizedRecoverable_Purgeable
values.description:
Denotes a vault state in which deletion is recoverable, and which also permits
immediate and permanent deletion (i.e. purge when 7<= SoftDeleteRetentionInDays
< 90). This level guarantees the recoverability of the deleted entity during
the retention interval, unless a Purge operation is requested, or the
subscription is cancelled.

values.name: CustomizedRecoverable
values.description:
Denotes a vault state in which deletion is recoverable without the possibility
for immediate and permanent deletion (i.e. purge when 7<=
SoftDeleteRetentionInDays < 90).This level guarantees the recoverability of the
deleted entity during the retention interval and while the subscription is
still available.

values.name: CustomizedRecoverable_ProtectedSubscription
values.description:
Denotes a vault and subscription state in which deletion is recoverable,
immediate and permanent deletion (i.e. purge) is not permitted, and in which
the subscription itself cannot be permanently canceled when 7<=
SoftDeleteRetentionInDays < 90. This level guarantees the recoverability of the
deleted entity during the retention interval, and also reflects the fact that
the subscription itself cannot be cancelled.

value.description: The DeletedSecretItem items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

value.description: The SecretItem items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

enabled.description: Determines whether the object is enabled.

recoverableDays.description:
softDelete data retention days. Value should be >=7 and <=90 when softDelete
enabled, otherwise 0.

recoveryLevel.description:
Reflects the deletion recovery level currently in effect for secrets in the
current vault. If it contains 'Purgeable', the secret can be permanently
deleted by a privileged user; otherwise, only the system can purge the secret,
at the end of the retention interval.

corresponding key backing the KV certificate.

managed.description:
True if the secret's lifetime is managed by key vault. If this is a secret
backing a certificate, then managed will be true.

a certificate, then managed will be true.
